oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville Confederate reunion button
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This button for a Confederate reunion in Nashville on June 14-16, 1904 belonged to Pvt. Lewis Cole, Co. B, 55th Tenn. (Brown's) Inf., CSA. The button has images of the Southern Cross, Lt. Gen. John Brown Gordon and a bald eagle upon an orb labeled "J. I.; Case Threshing Machine Co., Racine, Wis." The reverse side shows the button was made by Whitehead & Hoag Co., Newark, N.J. with patents on April 14, 1896 and July 21, 1896. Cole was born in Benton County, Tenn. in 1836 and died in Paris, Tenn. in 1925.
